utils package¶

utils.image_helpers¶

utils.image_helpers.find_image_any_format(filename: str, folder: str) → str | None¶

Given a format-less filename, try to find the file by appending each of the allowed formats to the given filename and check if the file exists :param filename: formatless filename :param folder: the relative folder in which to search :return: the path of the image if exists, otherwise None

utils.image_helpers.get_basename(file: str | FileStorage) → str¶

Return file’s basename, for example get_basename(‘some/folder/image.jpg’) returns ‘image.jpg’

utils.image_helpers.get_extension(file: str | FileStorage) → str¶

Return file’s extension, for example get_extension(‘image.jpg’) returns ‘.jpg’

utils.image_helpers.get_path(filename: str = None, folder: str = None) → str¶
utils.image_helpers.is_filename_safe(file: str | FileStorage) → bool¶

Check if a filename is secure according to our definition - starts with a-z A-Z 0-9 at least one time - only contains a-z A-Z 0-9 and _().- - followed by a dot (.) and a allowed_format at the end

utils.image_helpers.save_image(image: FileStorage, folder: str = None, name: str = None) → str¶

utils.json_to_csv¶

CircularWood_4.0 Database API
